newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Engen fuelled by result hopes, oil and rand.
newsitem.headline: Engen fuelled by result hopes, oil and rand.

text.p: Fuelled by high results expectations, rising oil prices and a weak rand, Engen Ltd surged nearly seven percent by Wednesday afternoon.

"We've always maintained that these results would be at the higher end of expectations. We're confident that they will show a much better second half which will carry the year," said an analyst who asked not to be identified.
Engen is due to post year results next Monday. Engen's recently floated upstream exploration and production unit Energy Africa is due to post year results this Thursday.
By 1045 GMT Engen had added 170 cents or 6.85 percent to 26.50 rand amid volumes 269,400 shares.
"Oil prices are at their high and there is a lot of focus on energy stocks at the moment. The rand is also depreciating so that also might help," one dealer said.
The rand was last at 4.57 against the dollar.
The recent sale of a 30 percent stake in Engen to Malaysia's state-owned Petronas had added lustre to the share, analysts said.
"The Petronas deal added a bit of froth to the price that wouldn't otherwise have come about," an analyst said.
Although the share looked set to rise further during the day against a relatively flat market, some analysts said that Engen was beginning to look too expensive.
"We do not regard it as a particularly favourable company. At these price levels it is rich. Maybe market participants are latching on to the expectations of good results," said one.
